tweets.text:
So @AnglianWater have been breaching their discharge permit on the River Cam since 2015. And the @EnvAgency does what exactly? 

PS. Take chalk water out of a river and replace it with treated sewage guess what? It's no longer a chalk stream, see the Upper Lea as an example. https://t.co/anhHcsCGIB

Any further news on the Price/ #RiverLugg ecocidal bank & dredging work investigation/prosecution? #roguefarmers
@SalmonTroutCons @envagencymids @envagency @Feargal_Sharkey @PrivateEyeNews @naturalengland @forestrycomm @davethroupea @hfdscouncil @wildlifetrusts @herefordtimes

The @EnvAgency are useless example 5,752.

In 2020 the EA set themselves a target of "Enhancing", 2,300km of rivers. A meaningless term much loved by the board.

They achieved 1,753km. So by their measurement they missed a totally made up, completely fatuous objective.

Ho hum. https://t.co/EBi3jF0k68

Our Geomatics team is in Lower #Penwortham this week taking additional street and property level information to support the Preston & South Ribble flood defence design. Find out more at: https://t.co/M8rbW9di9r #ERDF #Floodscheme https://t.co/0MMqvX8Yq5

tweets.text: Gardens of Bradford - a breeding and feeding ground for vermin @JudithCummins @Bradford_TandA @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyYNE #cityoffilth all @bradfordmdc do is warn, warn, warn. No action taken. https://t.co/5VdRHQ4tWO
@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency And abject failure to enforce agricultural pollution regulations. https://t.co/VaWVOKUYke

What do you think of this? https://t.co/vDHUGfFSLa

@CelticReptile @patrick_barkham @BenGoldsmith @gow_derek @NaturalEngland @ChrisGPackham @GeorgeMonbiot @ARC_Bytes @froglifers @PondRiverStream @EnvAgency @WWTconservation @WildlifeTrusts @angling_times @NFUtweets @CLAtweets https://t.co/2xpuP1Q6gt

@CanalRiverTrust @sandwellcouncil Still nothing been done to clean up at Titford pools despite being told to the contrary over *10 days* ago. It's absolutely disgraceful that this is being left in this state. How many more birds and fish have to be affected/die?! https://t.co/QiuhC5NJuj

Very important to support & respect our #drainage and #floodmanagement key workers who help protect people, property & the environment, especially at this time of year, whilst the rest of us stay at home. @ADA_updates @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK @WaterUK @LGAcomms #idbs @CMO_England

tweets.text: According to @guardian "Disposal of radioactive waste is one of six issues to be addressed before plant in Essex can go ahead" but no details given on @EnvAgency report. Anyone know more on this? "https://t.co/eILbAN6MdE

.@EnvAgency @EnvAgencyAnglia ... are you aware of this in incident reported by colleague Dr Barr? If so, can we have an update, please? If these fragile habitats are polluted, it can cause irreparable damage.

@MikeLiggins @EDP24 @BBCLookEast @BBCNorfolk @NorfolkCC https://t.co/t44aiheITr

We are excited to announce that funding has been secured for the BEACH Esk project. 

This project will create new saltmarsh habitat in the Esk estuary and reduce pollution in the estuary and it‚Äôs tributaries.

#EnvironmentProgramme #riverrestoration #Whitby https://t.co/hWmQTgUXKj

"#Regulation works. Done right, it creates a better world."

@WEETFEvents @EnvAgency

Good work from @FishFarmEA and @EnvAgencyMids.

3000 river-fit barbel and chub stocked into East Midlands rivers to help recover coarse fish populations.

Just some of the work paid for by income from #rodlicence sales.

https://t.co/S9tWA2Hd4n

Looking forward to (virtually) joining members of the Westminster Energy, Environment & Transport Forum (@WEETFEvents) this morning to discuss the future of environmental regulation.

Tweets to follow from 9am. https://t.co/AJYPlepI1k
Why would you even think of putting a tractor into a cover crop of Black Mustard at this time of year?! https://t.co/H5UmnDzOGd

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Happened to come across 3x  3x EA operatives by my local river a couple of days ago, asked them if they were responding to a pollution ‚Äúwe‚Äù reported in December ? Not a clue ! and not really interested either - grrr

Would you know what to do if a flood was forecast in your area? 

Now‚Äôs the best time to get planning to avoid damage to your property and treasured possessions - or even save a life. 

Know what to do in a flood: https://t.co/3jQgAKQj9B https://t.co/ZV8jKAZPR9

Help shape the Stour Valley Park, a visionary project that aims to connect 25km of the lower River Stour valley, from the Kingston Lacy estate to Hengistbury Head on the coast. tweets.text:
The Cambridge Water Treatment Plant has been exceeding its permit limiting the amount of treated sewage that can be released in the River Cam since 2015, the Environment Agency told me 
https://t.co/n5pGBEVNjF

So the @EnvAgency has published its annual report, 5 months late.

Apparently they "Have achieved a huge amount over the last year", obviously including, not a single river in England reaches 'Good' overall environmental health.

Spent ¬£1.431 billion and employed 10,229 staff. https://t.co/0aEhhtaw8p

@MarkAvery @CelticReptile @patrick_barkham @BenGoldsmith @gow_derek @NaturalEngland @ChrisGPackham @GeorgeMonbiot @ARC_Bytes @froglifers @PondRiverStream @EnvAgency @WWTconservation @WildlifeTrusts @angling_times @NFUtweets @CLAtweets I think it‚Äôs great to see young people doing this.  Good luck to them.
